intro: Rodrigueziella handroi f. icterina, commonly known as the yellow-flowered Rodrigueziella, is a flowering plant native to the island of Rodrigues in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in coastal areas or forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
